pr_title: [IOTDB-429] return empty dataset instead of throw exception

timeline.message: return empty dataset instead of throw exception

timeline.bodyText: What if columnInfoList is null? I think you can return 0 if it is null.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

replies.bodyText: I think it is okay to have null columnInfoList, which means some error occurs. If the size columnInfoList is 0, it means it is an empty list. What do you think?
replies.author: samperson1997

replies.bodyText: Actually, in the normal process, this couldn't be null, but in case others set a null in the future, check null is better
replies.author: qiaojialin

timeline.bodyText: If you also return 0 when it's null, like I suggested above, don't forget to change assert here.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: The comment here should be has an empty time column and device column
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: No need to do this change, the limit and offset are ignored in group by.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

replies.bodyText: Or you can add a JIRA to report this, actually in syntax, we support limit and offset in group by, but we just ignore these two in the code.
replies.author: JackieTien97
